wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Frederick Harrison Oxley (known professionally as Harrison Oxley and socially as Fred Oxley) (3 April 1933 – 6 April 2009) was a British organist, who was appointed Organist of St Edmundsbury Cathedral aged 24.  At the time, he was the youngest cathedral organist in the country.  He was the first English cathedral organist to supplement the boys' voices in the cathedral choir with those of girls; he began to use girls' voices in the early 1970s.

response: * Hit the Roof. 100 descants by Malcolm Archer, Christopher Gower, Richard Lloyd, Thomas McLelland Young and Harrison Oxley (Kevin Mayhew Ltd)

From 1948 he was head of music at King Edward's School, Birmingham.  His eminent pupil Harrison Oxley was his Assistant until leaving for Christ Church, Oxford in 1951.http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/comment/obituaries/article6187433.ece  From 1958 to 1972, Grant was professor of music at the University of Bristol.
